servinfo.title: DTC P0532: A/C Refrigerant Pressure Sensor Circuit Low

entry.ptxt: To electric load current sensor (for J20 engine) and MAP sensor

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

entry.ptxt: A/C refrigerant pressure sensor signal voltage is less than 0.15 V for 0.5 sec. continuously.
(1 driving detection logic but MIL does not light up)

attention3.ptxt: When DTC P0107 and P1501 are indicated together, it is possible that “GRY/RED” wire circuit open.

s1.ptxt: Connect scan tool to DLC with ignition switch turned OFF.
Turn ON ignition switch and clear DTC using scan tool.

attention3.ptxt: Before this trouble shooting is performed, read the precautions for DTC troubleshooting referring to Precautions For DTC Troubleshooting .

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check .

testgroup.title: A/C refrigerant pressure sensor power supply circuit check

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from A/C refrigerant pressure sensor with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper connection of A/C refrigerant pressure sensor at “GRY/RED”, “GRY/BLK” and “GRY/GRN” wire terminals.
Turn ON ignition switch, measure voltage between engine ground and “GRY/RED” wire terminal of A/C refrigerant pressure sensor connector.

testgroup.question: Is voltage 4 – 6 V?

testgroup.title: A/C refrigerant pressure sensor power supply circuit check

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connectors from ECM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Measure resistance between “GRY/RED” wire terminal of A/C refrigerant pressure sensor connector and “C37-14” terminal of ECM connector.

testgroup.question: Is resistance below 3 Ω?

testgroup.title: A/C refrigerant pressure sensor power supply circuit check

test1.ptxt: Measure resistance between engine ground and “C37-14” terminal of ECM connector.

testgroup.question: Is resistance infinity?

action.ptxt: “GRY/RED” wire is shorted to ground circuit.

testgroup.title: A/C refrigerant pressure sensor signal circuit check

test1.ptxt: Turn ON ignition switch, measure voltage between engine ground and “GRY/BLK” wire terminal of A/C refrigerant pressure sensor connector.

testgroup.question: Is voltage 4 – 6 V?

testgroup.title: A/C refrigerant pressure sensor signal circuit check

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connectors from ECM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Measure resistance between engine ground and “C37-12” terminal of ECM connector.

testgroup.question: Is resistance infinity?

action.ptxt: “GRY/BLK” wire is shorted to ground circuit.

test1.ptxt: Check A/C refrigerant pressure sensor referring to A/C Refrigerant Pressure Sensor and Its Circuit Inspection

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
